title: Early 70's over-size serif?
content:
Hi,  
Any ideas for a font for representing ’1972’?

regards,  
Fredrik

 [‹ Kitchen Aid Logo What font is it?](http://web.archive.org/web/20071021045929/http:/typophile.com/node/37997 "Go to previous forum topic") [wot da...? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071021045929/http:/typophile.com/node/37981 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Fredrik

comments.content:
dafont could be a good, free source of potential faces

[http://www.dafont.com/oh-my-god-stars.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20071021045929/http:/www.dafont.com/oh-my-god-stars.font "http://www.dafont.com/oh-my-god-stars.font")

or

[http://www.dafont.com/wizardry.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20071021045929/http:/www.dafont.com/wizardry.font "http://www.dafont.com/wizardry.font")

(basically serif gothic filled with stars, so check your conscience on this one!)

or

[http://www.dafont.com/pez.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20071021045929/http:/www.dafont.com/pez.font "http://www.dafont.com/pez.font")

Thanks Barthak,  
Jackpot was not the right one - but it got me on the right track.  
Got what I was looking for.  
F.

The swash version of Leitura Display is 70s-licious.

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/dstype/leitura-display/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071021045929/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/dstype/leitura-display/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/dstype/leitura-display/")

Souvenir or Cooper Black also evoke that era.
